a.title: Go to comments for Parent Letter 4-17

strong.a: Revised School Calendar for 4th Marking Period

a.title: Go to comments for Revised school calendar for 4th Marking Period

p.span: Yearbooks may be purchased using the following links. Orders are due by May 1st at 12 midnight. Yearbooks will be delivered to the school and distributed during a homework drop-off/distribution.

a.title: Go to comments for ES & MS Yearbooks

p.span: 2020 Yearbooks are still currently on sale to honor and celebrate such a special year for $68.00. Orders can also be placed online through the following link: https://www.yearbookordercenter.com/ Enter order #13298.

strong.span: High School orders need to be placed by Friday, April 24th.

a.title: Go to comments for High School Yearbook Sale

em.strong: How long will schools be closed?

br.span: The Governor has ordered the closure of all Pennsylvania public schoolsfor the remainder for the 2019-2020 school year. This includes all face to face classes and activities associated with school district operations. TheFlexible Instruction Dayplan is in full effect.

The BBHS Junior-Senior Prom has beenpostponedindefinitely. As more information is available from the PA Department of Health and the Pennsylvania Department of Education regarding large-group gatherings we will revisit possibilities of re-scheduling this event.

em.strong: How will the closure impact graduating Seniors?

br.span: Graduation status for seniors will be determined in accordance with past years. March 24 was the last day of the 3rd Marking Period. The 4th Marking Period began on March 25 and will conclude on Wednesday, May 27. Seniors who began the second semester on track to graduate, but are failing one or more classes required to graduate will hear from their guidance counselor, Mrs. McMillen. She will work with you to create a plan to earn your diploma.All seniors who intend to graduate this year must make an effort to do work assigned in order to be eligible to receive a BBSD diploma. Seniors who do not complete the process will be required to complete a credit recovery course in order to satisfy work requirements related to graduation and receiving a diploma.

We will recognize the graduation of the BBHS class of 2020. The details of the format, date, and time will be communicated to the members of the BBHS class of 2020 as those details are settled upon and finalized over the next 6 weeks. We will provide updates as we can. The State Department of Health and the Pennsylvania Department of Education will provide us with the guidance and directives that we must utilize.

Senior Awards will be granted. We are in the process of securing scholarship winners from the various organizations that routinely contribute to our graduating class, many of which students have applied for up to this point. We will be granting these to recipients as we have in previous years. We have yet to determine the format of a recognition of the winners of these awards. We will continue to communicate as details are narrowed and finalized. In the meantime, continue to watch the counseling website and communication from Mrs. McMillen.

em.strong: Since school is closed for the rest of the year, can I pick up my childs belongings?

br.span: Many students still have items at school (books, materials, instruments, clothing, etc.). We will be organizing a way for students to retrieve these items. We have three (3) days scheduled for pickup and drop-off between now and the end of the school year (April 23, May, 14, May 26). Please know that items currently at school are safe and secure.A process for accessing the materials will be communicated by Mr. Mudry and Mr. Thompson.

em.strong: Are there instructional expectations during the closure?

br.span: Yes!Students (and parents) are expected to communicate and make a good faith effort to complete work assigned by teachers. Grades will be assigned for work and be uploaded into Power School to compute grades for Marking Period 4 which ends on Wednesday, May 27.

em.strong: Will students have access to meals during the closure?

br.span: Yes! Our Grab and Go meal process will provide free breakfast and lunch meals to all children 18 and younger. Meal distribution is held on Mondays and Thursdays from 10-12 and will provide enough food for the interim days which include a breakfast and lunch.

em.strong: Will the Berlin Backpack Program continue?

br.span: Yes! Backpacks will be distributed every other Thursday. Backpacks will be distributed on April 23, May 7, and May 21 during the Grab and Go meal distribution.

span.strong: Affordable Internet at Home for Eligible Households:

a.title: Go to comments for Internet Access

p.span: Seniors & Juniors - Be sure to check out available scholarship opportunities.

a.title: Go to comments for Scholarship Opportunities

p.span: Southern Alleghenies Planning and Development Commissionwas recently awarded a grant from the Appalachian Regional Commission to complete an analysis of broadband needs in the region. The study will inventory existing broadband assets, identify gaps in service, and develop a plan for improving connectivity throughout the region. As part of the study, SAP&DC is conducting a survey to assess current levels of broadband service and needs.

br.span: The results of this survey will help guide SAP&DC on how best to ensure that residents and businesses in the region have affordable and adequate access to broadband internet. Participation is important, as it will help support future grant applications that can fund improved broadband infrastructure.
Take the survey in less than 5 minutes by visiting one of the follow websites:

a.title: Go to comments for Broadband Survey

h1.span: BBSD Ranks #2 as Best School in Somerset County!

img.style: display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;
img.title: BBSD ranked #2

h1.span: The Niche 2020 Best School Districts ranking is based on rigorous analysis of key statistics and millions of reviews from students and parents using data from the U.S. Department of Education. Ranking factors include state test scores, college readiness, graduation rates, SAT/ACT scores, teacher quality, public school district ratings, and more. For more information, click HERE.

a.title: Go to comments for Niche Best Schools in Somerset County

a.title: Go to comments for Safe To Say

p.span: In recent weeks, our nation has experienced heart wrenching and physically devastating violence. We want to acknowledge the toll that these events have taken on schools across the country. In the wake of these events, we want to reassure you that BBSD continues to provide a safe environment for our children to learn.

BBSD is vigilant in our efforts to ensure our schools are safe. We have a detailed emergency operations plan that lays out specific plans and responses related to prevention & mitigation, preparedness, response and recovery. We conduct regular drills that provide practice to our students and staff on how to best respond to emergency situations. Also, we continue to work closely with law enforcement and other security professionals to maximize our safety efforts.

Please know that BBSD continues to be proactive in our safety measures. We encourage the community to work with the school district and local police departments, and to report any issues that may cause you concern. If you see something, please say something, and encourage your children to do the same.

a.title: Go to comments for Letter to Community

p.span: Berlin Brothersvalley School District has steps in place to

span.span: address student and staff safety issues through the adoption of a

a.title: Go to comments for School Emergency Procedures

p.span: Berlin Brothersvalley School District has the ability to send out text alerts and messages. In order to participate in this service, your cell phone number must be in our student database AND you must indicate your willingness to receive text messages to your phone.

li.span: To participate in text messages: Text Y to 67587 from your wireless device.
If you prefer not to receive text messages: Text STOP to 67587.

p.span: *Although Berlin Brothersvalley School District does not charge for this service, it does not pay for text message charges that may be incurred by you for sending or receiving text messages. Check with your wireless carrier for possible charges.

a.title: Go to comments for School Messenger Alerts

p.em: MISSION STATEMENT: The mission of the Berlin Brothersvalley School District is to prepare students for the future by challenging their desire to learn and creating an environment that nutures their diversity of talents.

div.div: Equity In Education: This school district is an equal opportunity education institution and will not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex or handicap in its activities, programs, or employment practices as required by Title VI, Title IX, and Section 504. For information regarding civil rights, grievance procedures, or accessibility and use of the building by handicapped persons, contact Dr. David F. Reeder, Superintendent at 1025 Main Street, Berlin, PA 15530 (814) 267-4621.
